name: Zombie Defense (itch) (Corentin PB)
description:
The game :

This project has been made in 1 month during summer 2018. It's only a prototype and a way for me to learn how to use Unity (first game with Unity).

This is a 2D top-down shooter where you have to defend yourself against zombies for 10 waves. 

On the interface, you will have informations on which wave you are, how many zombies are still standing, you ammo status on the weapon you're holding and a stamina bar.

When you will fight, crates will spawn accross the map that will give you access to weapons that you don't own or ammunitions for the weapons you currently have. 

There are 3 different weapons in the game : A pistol, a sub-machine gun and a sniper. Each weapon has a reload time and a "firing break" (for the sniper especially).

Controls :
  • Move with WASD.
  • Fire with left click.
  • Aim with right click (mandatory with the sniper).
  • Change weapon with the mouse wheel.
  • Run with shift.
  • Melee attack with F.
  • Main menu with escape
Notes :

I worked alone on this project and even though I tested the game so there are no "breaking bugs", some bugs might appear with the character and weapons (mainly on the animations). I didn't want to spent more time on this project as I wanted to move on to another one and I didn't have enough time.

I used a FOV script from Sebastian Lague (https://github.com/SebLague). 

Music and sounds comes from SoundEffectFactory and Stefan Persson (https://www.imphenzia.com/) with the Unity package "Universal Sound FX". I used A* Pathfinding for the zombies AI. Some sprites are available to download here : 
https://www.deviantart.com/corentinpb/gallery/67395694/Zombie-Defense.
